title: Neighbours pays tribute as creator Reg Watson dies aged 93
text:
The creator of Neighbours has passed away (Picture: Twitter)

Reg Watson, creator of Neighbours and other Australian dramas, has died aged 93.

His death was confirmed by show bosses on social media who paid tribute, with reports claiming he died after a short illness (via TV Tonight AU).

In a post on Twitter, Neighbours executive producer, Jason Herbison, wrote: ‘Everyone at Neighbours is sad to hear of the passing of our creator, Reg Watson.

‘He was a pioneer of drama, prolific in his output and by all accounts a lovely person to work with. His legacy lives on in Ramsay Street to this day.’

'Everyone at Neighbours is sad to hear of the passing of our creator, Reg Watson. He was a pioneer of drama, prolific in his output and by all accounts a lovely person to work with. His legacy lives on in Ramsay Street to this day.' – Jason Herbison – Neighbours EP pic.twitter.com/BbfkFwKN6Q — Neighbours (@neighbours) October 12, 2019

Along with the Australian soap, Reg also created dramas such as Prisoner, The Young Doctors, and worked on ITV soap Crossroads.

Neighbours was first broadcast on the Seven Network in March 1985, with the network commissioning the soap after the success of Watson’s previous soap Sons And Daughters.

The show became a launch pad for the careers of many huge stars, including Kylie Minogue, Margot Robbie, Liam Hemsworth, Russell Crowe, and Jason Donovan.

The latter paid tribute to Watson on Twitter, writing: ‘Many Australian Entertainment careers have a lot to thank for this man. A legend.. Mr Reg Watson.’

Home And Away writer Bevan Lee said: ‘Reg Watson was a trailblazer in Australian commercial television drama.

Anne Charleston as Madge Bishop and Ian Smith as Harold Bishop (Picture: Fremantle Media/REX)

Kylie Minogue and Jason Donovan got their first break on Neighbours (Picture: Fremantle Media/REX)

‘He also mentored many of its top writing talent and production talents over the years, including myself, John Holmes, Rick Maier, Sue Smith, Paltrea Smallacombe, Greg Haddrick, Coral Drouyn, Jason Herbison and John Misto.

‘He also gave a start to many actors who have gone on to tread the world stage, especially through his creation Neighbours. This, Sons and Daughters, Prisoner and The Young Doctors. What a creative legacy! Why is he NOT in the Hall Of Fame?’

Neighbours airs weekdays on Channel 5 at 5.30pm.
